column5: (The following statement was released by the rating agency) CHICAGO  December 15 (Fitch) Fitch Ratings has affirmed Prudential Financial   Inc.'s (PFI) 'A-' Issuer Default Rating (IDR).  In addition  Fitch has affirmed  the 'A+' Insurer Financial Strength (IFS) rating assigned to Prudential  Insurance Company of America and certain other affiliated insurance companies.  The Rating Outlook is Positive.   A full list of ratings can be found at the end  of this release.   KEY RATING DRIVERS The aff

column4: Rio Tinto seals $4.4 bln financing for Mongolia copper expansion
column5: SYDNEY  Dec 15 Rio Tinto  locked in $4.4 billion in financing on Tuesday to fund a massive expansion of a copper mine in Mongolia and a final decision whether to proceed with construction will be made in the first half of 2016.

column4: EBRD says arranges $1.2 bln syndicated loan for Mongolian mine
column5: LONDON  Dec 15 Development bank EBRD said on Tuesday it had arranged its biggest ever syndicated loan  a $1.2 billion facility that will contribute towards an overall $4.4 billion package of financing for Mongolia's Oyu Tolgoi copper mine.

column4: Sanofi plans to reshape via $20 billion asset swap with Boehringer
column5: PARIS/LONDON Sanofi and Boehringer Ingelheim are in exclusive talks over a $20 billion swap of the French pharmaceuticals company's animal health business for the family-owned German group's consumer health operation.

column4: UPDATE 3-Sanofi plans to reshape via $20 bln asset swap with Boehringer
column5: * Sanofi shares jump more than 4 percent   (Adds banks advising Boehringer  Boehringer comment on financing  updates shares  link to Breakingviews)

column4: Boehringer CEO says negotiations with Sanofi to be complex
column5: FRANKFURT Boehringer Ingelheim expects negotiations with Sanofi about the drugmakers' planned asset swap to be complex but is confident the deal can be wrapped up by the end of next year.

column4: Boehringer CEO says negotiations with Sanofi to be complex
column5: FRANKFURT  Dec 15 Boehringer Ingelheim expects negotiations with Sanofi about the drugmakers' planned asset swap to be complex but is confident the deal can be wrapped up by the end of next year.

column5: PARIS  Dec 15 Sanofi and Boehringer Ingelheim on Tuesday announced they were in exclusive talks to swap the French pharmaceuticals company's animal health business for the family-owned German group's consumer health operation.

column5: * Says Aibel was today granted a new framework agreement for the supply of maintenance and modification services to Statoil

column4: SMFG agrees to buy GE's Japan leasing business for $4.8 billion
column5: TOKYO Sumitomo Mitsui Financial Group Inc (SMFG)  agreed to buy General Electric's  Japanese leasing business for $4.8 billion  the two companies said on Tuesday.

column4: Suncor urges Canadian Oil Sands shareholders to tender shares to its offer
column5: Dec 15 Canada's largest oil and gas company Suncor Energy Inc urged shareholders of Canadian Oil Sands Ltd to tender their shares to its offer for the company.

column4: BRIEF-TSMC orders machinery equipment for T$516 mln
column5: * Says orders machinery equipment worth T$516 million  ($15.74 million)

column4: Taiwan to cut rates further in 2016 as global outlook weakens
column5: TAIPEI Taiwan's export-driven economy  a bellwether for the world's technology sector  is likely to post its weakest annual growth since the global financial crisis this year  but the island's central bank may not resume easing monetary policy until early 2016.

column4: UPDATE 3-Vivendi wins four seats on Telecom Italia's board
column5: * French group abstained from vote on planned stock conversion   (Updates after vote to give Vivendi board representation)

column4: Blackstone raises $18 billion for global buyout fund
column5: Blackstone Group LP   the largest alternative asset manager  said on Monday it had raised $18 billion for its latest global private equity fund  highlighting the healthy pace of fundraising by large buyout firms.

column4: CANADA STOCKS-TSX jumps off 2013 lows as energy bounces  Valeant soars
column5: TORONTO  Dec 15 Canada's main stock index bounded higher off 2013 lows on Tuesday  helped by big gains in the energy sector as crude oil halted a slide to 11-year lows and shares in Valeant Pharmaceuticals International Inc  surged 16 percent.

column4: Valeant gets boost from new distribution deal with Walgreens
column5: Reuters) - Valeant Pharmaceuticals International Inc on Tuesday said it reached a deal to distribute its drugs through leading pharmacy chain Walgreens Boots Alliance Inc  boosting credibility with wary investors and sending its shares up 17 percent.

column4: UPDATE 3-Valeant gets boost from new distribution deal with Walgreens
column5: * Deal with Walgreens more than replaces Philidor-Valeant CEO

column4: BRIEF-Valeant CEO says will get back to acquisitions - but not next year
column5: * CEO says will get back to acquisitions  but not next year  when it will focus on paying down debt instead - CNBC

column4: Valeant signs distribution deal with Walgreens  offers price cuts
column5: Dec 15 Canadian drugmaker Valeant Pharmaceuticals International Inc  said it signed a deal to distribute its skin and eye products at a discount in more than 8 000 Walgreens Boots Alliance Inc  retail pharmacy locations.

column4: Early praise for Star Wars awakens the Force in shares of Disney  EA
column5: SAN FRANCISCO Early praise for the newest installment of "Star Wars" gave a boost to shares of Walt Disney and Electronic Arts  which recently launched a videogame based on the hugely popular space opera. | Video
